intro: Cucurbita maxima var. clypeiformis, commonly known as the warty pumpkin, is a variant of the common squash belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, irregularly shaped, warty fruit that can range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. The plant is a vigorous vine with large, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that typically appear in clusters. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil and full sunlight for optimal growth. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance.
